songs.title: Best Friend
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Ricky Racks, I see you!
Thugger!
YSL for life, bitch
Yeah fuck you, your momma and everything else
Free the GOAT!

[Hook]
That's my best friend, that's my best friend, flexin'
Big ol' booty bitch missus from Texas, what's next is
I'm gon' skeet off, lil nigga come catch me, catch me
And that's my bestie, my bestie, my best friend, go best friend
Nigga livin' TTG and everything is still on fleek
Bad bitch rollin' wit' me, she gon' smile 'cause she on fleek
Hundred thousand dollars inside my pants, my shit on fleek
Hey-yeah! Yeah

[Verse 1]
Take them boys to school, swagonometry
Bitch I'm bleedin' bad, like a bumble bee
Hold up! Hold it, hold it, nigga proceed
I'ma eat that booty just like groceries
Eat on that coochie, lay that bitch down like "let's do it"
No Tiger, bitch, eat that wood, eat that wood
Supplier, bitch, I got pistols, no wood
I want them tacos that are Meagan Good
Helicopter choppin' with the buzz
Stuff them racks inside them if they nudge
Bang that other side, nigga curb
And my reefer louder than a speaker
Yeah my niece is hangin' with The Beatles
If you ever find her, better keep her
37 cameras for the sneakers
Goin' out like Ox or Beanie Sigel
Send a cop, I can't wait to mistreat 'em
Forcin' your ho, I can't wait to mislead 'em
And beat 'em, they ain't my people

[Hook]
That's my best friend, that's my best friend, flexin'
Big ol' booty bitch missus from Texas, what's next is
I'm gon' skeet off, lil nigga come catch me, catch me
And that's my bestie, my bestie, my best friend, go best friend
Nigga livin' TTG and everything is still on fleek
Bad bitch rollin' wit' me, she gon' smile 'cause she on fleek
Hundred thousand dollars inside my pants, my shit on fleek
Hey-yeah! Yeah!

[Verse 2]
Let me tell you how I spent a couple hundreds today
I done cut back on that lean, I'm on that Hen' and D'ussé
Don't do no talkin', when you see him, you better shoot in his face
I got a hundred bitches that can't wait to replace
Michael Jackson, nigga, Thugger Jackson moon walkin'
The S.L.I.M.E. army tool shoppin'
Me a horny goat, I'm boolin' at the bull stop
No I can't get arrested 'cause I'm talkin' 'bout my necklace
I'ma put that bitch in the buck, I'm a dog, let's get stuck

I'm gon' skeet off, lil nigga come catch me, catch me

Bad bitch rollin' wit' me, she gon' smile 'cause she on fleek
Hundred thousand dollars inside my pants, my shit on fleek
Hey-yeah!

[Produced by Ricky Racks & Young Shad]

description.plain:
“Best Friend” is the fifth song on Thugger’s first edition of Slime Season.  Produced by Young Shad and Ricky Racks, Thug comes hard with his crooning and braggadocios style to brag about his bestie.

“Best Friend” officially went platinum in 2016.

https://twitter.com/youngthug/status/749404633945219072

This song was met with controversy upon release when Louisiana rapper Tokyo Vanity threatened to sue Thugger. According to Complex Magazine, Vanity is threatening to sue Thugger for copyright infringement, claiming he stole her song “That’s My Best Friend.”

The Fader interviewed the director of the music video, Be El Be, who shared his opinion on who Thuggers “best friend” really is:

If [Young Thug is] his own butler, if he’s catching himself with himself, making love to himself, if he’s in the bathroom getting changed and it’s just him and him—it’s showing his best friend is himself. That self-esteem! He’s a very stylish young man, so I would say that the inside meaning of that is that he is his own best friend.

On September 14th, 2015 the official music video was released by Young Thug. It is co-directed by Be El Be and the visuals show Thugger running into himself in everything he does. Pitchfork said it best (in regards to describing the video):

Young Thug’s video for “Best Friend” begins with Young Thug walking in on Young Thug, who’s in the process of hooking up with Young Thug. Then, Thug jumps in a car driven by Thug. Eventually, Thug’s head is served at a dinner attended by Thug. 

Fun Fact: 5 months later from the release of the music video, Young Thug read out the lyrics on GQ  so people can understand him better and simply for laughs and giggles!

https://youtu.be/IVRXJ1Gd33g

[Verse 2]

Niggas was fake so I kept me a Ruger in Regals
Droppin' the top on the Bentley
I'm with the Birdman, yeah the eagle
Geeked out my mind, man I'm tripping out
I don't know none of these people

description.plain:
Thug teams up with hit maker London on da Track to create a booming new single about all the money he’s racking up. Check out the music video below!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RAzzv6Ks9nc

Thug talks about how this song came about in his interview with Clique:


‘Cause at any given time I could learn something and I really want to express it right when I learn it, like “Oh wow, pull the beat up.”

I got a check, like, I just got a check: 650,000. I’m in the studio, she bring me the check. I’m like “What the fuck.” I’m like, “Got a check I got a check,” and just made a song.

Diamonds boolin' on my chest, no fuckin' blouser
Bitch, I make it rain shower, ya dig that?
Ain't no one know a thing about ya, if you zip that
Hit 'em with that blocka-blocka, nigga get back
Beat that bitty, never crack, dig that (Sheesh, sheesh)

[Verse 1: Young Thug]
Before I go without a sack, I swag pack (Sheesh, sheesh)
I spoiled my bitch and now she actin' like a brat (Yeah, yeah)
I met Alex, I know Jimmy, he got racks (Skrt, skrrt)
Yeah, yeah, bitch I'm bleedin' like a tat (Yeah, yeah)
Roll it, roll it, for me on 'ya back (Roll it, roll it)
Just for show my diamonds yellow like a taxi (Woo! Woo!)
I'm a cat, I'ma chase all them pussy rats (Argh)
Ya-ah (Argh, argh), pussy nigga better not look back
Or-or else I'm killin' 'em, he-ey, and that's a fact (Sheesh)
There's blood all on my Timberlands
She make a nigga say, "Whaat?!" (What?!)
I swear to God she feelin' 'em
She sucked like eight dicks, I call her Octagon (Hey!)

[Hook: Young Thug]
First you get that money then you get that power
If he turn his nose up, boy he on that powder
Now you walk around with 50 in your trousers
Diamonds boolin' on my chest, no fuckin' blouser

Ain't no one know a thing about ya, if you zip that
Hit 'em with that blocka-blocka, nigga get back
Beat that bitty, never crack, dig that (Sheesh, sheesh)

[Verse 2: Young Thug]
Bitch, I dig it, I eat ice cream with my chickens
Bitch, I'm rich just like a Simmons, not Lil Diggy
If I got legs, bitch you know I'm gonna get it
She got good head, so she welcome to my Bentley
Big bid-ness in that big Bentley, Bentley (What? What?)
Ridin' 'round with that semi, 'cause I know these niggas envy (Hah)
Is you mad 'bout Instagram or how I kick my pimpin'? (Pimp)
You keep that Ace of Spades, I'm sippin'
I'm a rocket, rocket, I can't stop it, stop it
I'm a GTV, boy, bitch I'm poppin, poppin'
I need coke, need coke like, "Where the fuck is papi?"
If you try to run off (What?), you know we popped your noggin
(Pop-pop)

[Hook: Young Thug]
First you get that money then you get that power
If he turn his nose up, boy he on that powder
Now you walk around with 50 in your trousers
Diamonds boolin' on my chest, no fuckin' blouser
Bitch, I make it rain shower, ya dig that?
Ain't no one know a thing about ya, if you zip that
Hit 'em with that blocka-blocka, nigga get back

description.plain: This song navigates different power struggles within Young Thug’s life. Whether he’s making money, fighting with his girlfriend, dealing with snitches, or doing drugs, he’s always looking to get one up on someone.

description.plain:
This song is Young Thug’s first major hit that brought him much attention & made him a major face in the ATL trap scene.

The song’s major themes are addressed the name which is Young Thug’s admiration for / dependance on drugs especially, marijuana.



After a long time of waiting Young Thug finally delivered the official music video for “Stoner” on 10 May 2014. The video includes guest appearances of Birdman, Migos, Fabo and a lot more.

Cop on iTunes here!

Danny Glover is most recognized for his role in the Lethal Weapon films. In these films, he was partnered with Mel Gibson.



Young Thug is saving these hoes (a la Danny Glover in the Lethal Weapon film series) because he’s so rich and it’s nothing to him. Thugger is also describing how he’s going to save them with some good wood.

description.plain: Young Thug teams up with Atlanta’s Trouble. The duo trade bars as they appropriate the term “thief in the night” to night of debauchery. description.plain:
“Chanel (Go Get It)” sees Thugger, YSL signee Gunna, and fellow ATLien Lil Baby singing about spending time with a female and allowing them to purchase luxury items.

Together the three list off the many designer brands they’d be willing to buy their respective women, such as Chanel, Christian Louboutin, Fendi, Hermès, Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Marc Jacobs, Yves Saint Laurent, and Dior.

Gunna, Baby, and Thugger would also be willing to purchase their women different luxury vehicles including: Bentley Sedans, Mercedes Benz, Lamborghini’s, Porche Cayenne’s, Mercedes G-Wagon’s, and Range Rovers.

When Slime Language’s features were initially announced, Lil Baby wasn’t listed as one of the guests on the project. However, soon after, feature list was updated to include his name. This is because he was only added to “Chanel (Go Get It)” shortly before the song’s release, replacing a verse by Lil Uzi Vert, as revealed in the demo version that leaked in early November 2018. This also explains why Baby’s verse was updated a few days after the song’s initial release.

description.plain:
“Relationship” sees Thugger and Future croon over an instrumental reminiscent of early 2000s R&B and brag about their relationships with different women.

This song is their second collaboration since Young Thug and Future’s beef which began in November of 2015 when producer Metro Boomin sent out  a series of tweets that stated Future started the trend of releasing multiple mixtapes per year, and that other artists should focus on dropping one good project. Young Thug, who already released multiple mixtapes that year, believed the tweets were directed at him, and sent multiple shots at Metro. Future also took to Twitter that night with a tweet that many believed was directed towards Thugger.

Another Twitter battle took place between Thug and Future hours before the release of Future’s album EVOL. In September of 2016, Thug publicly apologized to Future, officially squashing their beef. They recently collaborated on the DJ Esco track, “Who”.



This song’s production is handled by BL$$D, producer of the hit song Rolex, and Billboard Hitmakers, a production group who assisted with many of the tracks on Young Thug’s last mixtape Jeffery.

description.plain:
“Digits” is a cut off of Slime Season 3—one of the four tracks on the album produced by London On Da Track.

Leading up to the song’s release, snippets of the song were stitched together. This song was officially premiered on Zane Lowe’s Beats Radio, on March 24, 2016.

The official version with Meek Mill was dropped by Funk Master Flex on April 2nd.

In an interview with the FADER, London on Da Track recalled making “Digits,” “Memo,” “Worth It” and “Tattoo” all in one day. The tracks are two years old, but he remembered how “Digits” came together:

When he was laying down, he was just freestyling it—just doing melodies in the booth—and I was like, “That’s the shit right there.” Then he figured out the words and from there he just flowed the whole track. It was easy for him, he does it in one take. It’s crazy how he can finish a song in ten minutes.

description.plain:
“Wyclef Jean,” also known as “NASCAR,” is named after Haitian rapper and one of Thugger’s idols Wyclef Jean, best known for being in The Fugees.

Wyclef Jean is also featured on “Kanye West,” the 9th track of this project.

The beat contains elements of Caribbean and Reggae music, almost as an extra nod to Wyclef Jean. The electric guitar chords and bassline are unique to the aforementioned style of music.

Bitch, I got water, I look like I'm fresh from Hawaii
Havin' the time of my motherfuckin' life
I'm gonna buy everything I want, I can't think twice

As long as I live, wouldn't want a wife

Hey, a very good ti-i-iiime

description.plain:
In the days leading up to the release of the song, Young Thug and Metro beefed after the producer sent out a tweet that Thugger thought was aimed at him. A lot of fans thought it was a publicity stunt to promote their new release, but Thugger and Metro both claim it was real—and now squashed.

https://twitter.com/MetroBoomin/status/665050848318263296

While this track was officially released at 10:22 PM on November 12th, 2015, Thug previewed the full track live on Periscope at 5:55 AM the previous day.

Ed-umacation abort, bookin' these dorks

(It's Guwop), again

description.plain: “Again” is the thirteenth track off Young Thug’s mixtape Slime Season. Gucci’s verse is sampled from the intro to his mixtape Trap House 4. When asked about it, engineer Alex Tumay stated it was London On Da Track’s idea to reuse the verse for “Again.”

description.plain:
This song is named after Gucci Mane (A.K.A Guwop), an Atlanta rapper considered to be one of the founding fathers of trap and is responsible for the way trap music is today.

On May 26th 2016, Gucci Mane was released from prison after spending two years locked up for possession of a firearm. Just a month later, he released his album Everybody Looking which also featured Jeffery on the track “Guwop Home”.

GUWOP also has a meaning to it, explained by Gucci himself on Twitter: https://twitter.com/gucci1017/status/524742715465277440

On this track, Jeffery, along with Young Scooter and Quavo and Offset of Migos pay homage to the godfather of trap.

Thugger drops a new song for Valentine’s Day declaring his love for his fiancée, Jerrika Karlae. He talks about how he’ll make sure she’ll never have to work again, as well as how he’ll try as hard as possible to maintain their relationship.

description.plain:
Young Thug named this song to honor Harambe, the beloved gorilla who was killed after a child fell into his enclosure at the Cincinnati Zoo on May 28, 2016.

Thug pays his respects to and remembers Harambe with this track. He said on Twitter that the songs were named after his idols, making Harambe the youngest idol on the album, aged just 17 at his death.

After the shooting, there was controversy as to whether or not killing Harambe was the right decision. While some claimed that it was justified, others disagree, claiming that the tragic death could have been avoided.

In August 2016, 2 and a half months after Harambe died, a new wave of memes surfaced, spawning multiple opinion pieces on the topic. This track has ensured the matter remains in the public eye.

description.plain:
Young Thug, Travis Scott, Gunna & Gucci rap about a luxury lifestyle on “Floyd Mayweather”, the track is named after American boxer Floyd Mayweather Jr., who is nicknamed “Money” and “Pretty Boy.”

Floyd Mayweather actually almost signed Young Thug to his TMT music label in the past. They’ve also been spotted in the studio together this year.

Thug has mentioned Mayweather before numerous songs, including “Heart Attack”, “Mind Right”, and “Yamborghini Dream”.

There are three versions of the song. The original release did not include Travis Scott and a Gunna verse, but it was later updated on Apple Music and other streaming services to include the Gunna verse after Gucci and the Travis verse after the next Thug verse. In the third version, which is now the one playing on all streaming services, the Gunna verse comes in before the Gucci verse with another bar at the beginning, and the rest of the song is mostly similar to the second version.

Although Young Thug and Travis Scott have collaborated on eight prior songs, this song along with “Pick Up The Phone” mark the first time Travis Scott has ever appeared on one of Thug’s projects.

description.plain: Young Thug’s fiance, Jerrika Karlae, originally uploaded a snippet of “Feel It” to her Instagram in early-mid 2015. After many previews of the song were teased, the song leaked in early 2017. It was later re-mixed and mastered, and made its way onto Thug’s 2017 singing album, BEAUTIFUL THUGGER GIRLS.

description.plain:
Young Thug’s first single off of his highly anticipated mixtape I’m Up is the surprisingly upbeat and bouncy track “Fuck Cancer.”

The song’s title is inspired by Thug’s friend Boosie Badazz (né Lil Boosie) who recently had surgery to remove a cancerous tumor from his kidney.

The music video explains how the subject matter of the song relates to the song’s title. Boosie makes a guest appearance in the video and they celebrate his overcoming cancer. So the song is about celebrating Boosie’s life and ability to have fun/party now that he’s overcome cancer.

description.plain:
Young Thug, 2 Chainz, Wiz Khalifa and PnB Rock collaborated on this cut from the soundtrack of the motion picture “The Fate of the Furious,” the eight installment in the “Fast and Furious” movie franchise.

The soundtrack’s 4th release finds the aforementioned artists rapping about themes of teamwork and coming up together as a gang,  as it is a recurring theme in the movie franchise.

description.plain:
“Anybody” is the first single of 2018 by Atlanta artist Young Thug, with his first collaboration with Nicki Minaj since 2014’s “Danny Glover” remix.

The song was leaked two days ahead of its expected release on April 13, 2018, and it came as somewhat of a surprise to fans considering that Thugger previously said he wouldn’t be releasing any music in 2018.

On April 10, both artists hinted at the song’s release after they both tweeted the number “3”. Thug’s go-to engineer, Alex Tumay, also joined in, further adding to the speculation.

description.plain:
Young Thug’s version of Drake’s “The Language”. The name of the song is even taken, and the letter B is added to symbolize Young Thug’s affiliation with the Blood Gang.

Note how his flow is similar to Drake’s from the original song, and how even the cover art pays homage to one of his earlier mixtapes, So Far Gone.

description.plain:
This song, now called “Kanye West,” went through numerous title changes before and after it’s release; previous titles included “Elton John,” “Wet Wet,” and “Pop Man.”

This song—at the time called “Pop Man”—was the first single released from JEFFERY, the tape previously known as No, My Name is JEFFERY, and Young Thug. This is Thug’s first collaboration with Wyclef Jean, and Thugger later named track one of JEFFERY in his honor.

The production is handled by Wheezy and Zaytoven’s right hand man, Cassius Jay, who’s influence on the beat is clearest in the keyboard melody found in the pre-hook—which is reminiscent of his mentor Zaytoven’s preferred instrumentation.

songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Young Thug]
So what's up with all that goddamn tough talk you had earlier on the phone, you know what I'm saying? When you said you was gon' goddamn do this and that to me when you saw me?
(freaky-deeky)
Where all that at? Oh I thought so
You got high a level of confidence, you know what I'm saying

[Chorus: Young Thug]
You said you gon' fuck me to death when you see me
You said that, you said that
You said you gon' do me the worst, I remember you right when you said that
You said you gon' kiss from my neck to my chest to my naval and dick and nuts
We talked about everything, then you know that we got us some making up
I lick on that puss on a pill, and I make her stand up like some bunny ears
I bite on her butt and I suck on her toes and her soul go outta here
She look at him like he roadkill and I turned 'round her life like I'm Dr. Phil
Let's get freaky deeky 'round here

[Post-Chorus: Young Thug]
Say now, ooh, ooh, ooh

Say now, ooh, ooh, ooh (I want you to say now)
Say now (Jeffery!), ooh, ooh, ooh

I ain't never needed nothing brodie
All full pocket, macaroni

Say now, ooh, ooh, ooh (I want you to)

description.plain: In “You Said”, the seventh track off Beautiful Thugger Girls, Young Thug describes a relationship between himself and a woman. In this song, she seems to promise a lot to him, yet always fails to deliver. While she seems to have a sexual attraction to Thugga, it seems to be nothing more than that.

Just to be safe (just to be safe)

I spend more money on security than I make
Just to be safe, dawg

[Verse 1]

Cause everything I get, I try to invest it in you
You too and you too
In the daytime a nigga havin' nightmares
I wonder if he answerin' every one of my prayers
Hate to say it but I go broke 'bout anyone of my peers
You ain't gon' never change this shit
Yea, I'm bustin' down, yeah

Ain't gon' get no second chance, you crossed me
I don't give a fuck about you
Yea, I'ma give up on you

I'ma throw it up by ya, yea, you better have luck by ya
Can't nobody ever beat the triple cross
I got snake in my veins, snake in my drawls
I got snake on my attire, snake inside my wounds

Don't plan on lettin' nobody take their place
I pay more money to security than I make
And it's crazy but it's safe
I get to run around in peace everyday
I know my niggas go monkey like Bathing Ape
I tried to tell you, but you had to learn late
I was just holdin' you down and you didn't stay down like you 'posed to
I had you rollin' around in that Bentley Mulsanne and the Rolls too
I had you glossin' on all of these bitches just like you was 'posed to
I got you latest Chanel, and the latest Fendi, and the Gucci too

description.plain:
“Safe” was a surprise drop by Young Thug on February 23, 2017. In this track, Thugga talks about many of the insecurities that are overshadowed by his public reputation. Often finding himself in the spotlight for various reasons, whether positive or negative , Young Thug proves that he has more going on underneath the surface than we realize.

The track is Thug’s first release since 2016’s JEFFERY mixtape.

description.plain:
The title of the song likely refers to the rapper Webbie.

Like many of the song titles in this album, Webbie was likely chosen as the title because he is one of the artists from which Young Thug draws inspiration.

Webbie, a rapper from Baton Rouge, has also collaborated with Boosie Badazz, whom Young Thug gave tribute to in “F Cancer” after he was diagnosed with cancer.

Young Thug has mentioned on Instagram how each song on the mixtape was named after one of his idols.

description.plain:
The title of this track is referencing pop artist Rihanna.



Throughout the hook Thug repeats the word “work,” which is likely referencing Rihanna’s hit track “Work” from her 2016 album, ANTI.

The track is produced by Wheezy, a producer who was prevalent on Young Thug’s last album, Barter 6.

songs.title: Can't Tell
songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Young Thug]
Eh
Can't tell, yeah

[Hook: Young Thug]
Niggas say they fuck with you, I can't tell, $500,000 Chevelle
I got bricks and birds for retail, I got 100,000 worth of belts
These bitches and these niggas know that they can't play around here
I call the spot elementary cause I keep a K around here
All my Aces if you play they make you grady baby
I might shoot you in your head and then it's no more thinking
Pussy boy I'll leave you dead and call it dead-ication
I put Act inside my drink, they call it medication

[Verse 1: T.I.]
Hold up, pull up, roll up, pour up, ounces in a soda
Push up on your bitch and shawty I didn't even know her
See this hood I throw up, realest one I ever seen
ATL, call it XXL, cause we stay spittin' shells outta long magazine
Real nigga got a crown, better own that thing
If the game got a throne, bet I'm on that thing
Beloved dope dealer and a well known King
And a killer 'pending on how you put your spin on things
You know how many suckers get ahead I've seen?
Bout the same amount of pussy niggas dead I've seen
You know how many bitches in the bed I've seen?
That like asking me how much bread I've seen
More than enough, in God we trust
You love a real niggas then fuck with us
But if you got a problem with it then fuck with us
It be ashes to ashes, dust to dust
Got your bitch riding everything but the bus
She let me put it everywhere but the butt
I always tell the bitch don't talk so much
She said "Who I'm hidin' from? What the fuck, for what?"

[Hook: Young Thug]
Niggas say they fuck with you, I can't tell, $500,000 Chevelle
I got bricks and birds for retail, I got 100,000 worth of belts
These bitches and these niggas know that they can't play around here
I call the spot elementary cause I keep a K around here
All my Aces if you play they make you grady baby
I might shoot you in your head and then it's no more thinking
Pussy boy I'll leave you dead and call it dead-ication
I put Act inside my drink, they call it medication

[Verse 2: Young Thug]
Man I'm leanin' so bad
I can't do a push up for a million
(Lean, lean, lean, lean, lean)
Catch a nigga baby mama
Make her give me nothing but ceiling (head)
Never had time to rap and cap
And dap these tramps, my ice a lamp
I can't adapt, I'd rather slap
I rather pop his cap and naps
His mom, his aunt, his dad, his cat
2004 I was screaming everything Gucci, no Big Cat
And we was skatin' up, ridin' with the K's
Shootin' at all these big racks
Fuck a officer, Akon what it do bruh?
Keep these fuckin' hoes off of you
When you get some new money turn new or
You gon' wish you would've, could've (waaaay)
Sit down and get rich like a booker
Might drop the top up off it
If I don't get into the helicopter
Feeling like I'm on a blue dolphin
Nigga ridin' round with like hella choppers
Every time I need new surgery I gon' call up my head doctor
5 more thousands cause she ain't got no head problems
(She the best, she the best)
Yeah, all my niggas they be bleedin' nigga
They ain't gon' never cheat a nigga
Pop a watermelon any season, nigga
I'ma bag her every time I see her, nigga
Fishing hoes with my hook
Pockets all swollen, no book
Glasses on, she don't know how I look (nerdy, nerdy)
Since I'm on how the fuck do I look? (I'm on, I'm on)
You ain't got no milli, you can't tell me how I look
I'm a big old Blood over here, I'm Suge

[Hook: Young Thug]
Niggas say they fuck with you, I can't tell, $500,000 Chevelle
I got bricks and birds for retail, I got 100,000 worth of belts
These bitches and these niggas know that they can't play around here
I call the spot elementary cause I keep a K around here
All my Aces if you play they make you grady baby
I might shoot you in your head and then it's no more thinking
Pussy boy I'll leave you dead and call it dead-ication
I put Act inside my drink, they call it medication

[Verse 3: Boosie Badazz]
You ain't read the paper, you ain't seen the news
Got a team of goons bout action
Never start it, but I finish it so nasty
Ask em, they know bout me
I'm so Keyshia with the 9, rock a bye baby
So smooth, so fly baby, rock a bye baby
Let me turn up now, 4 shows a week
100 thousand a piece, we getting bread now
Mama don't worry bout nothin'
You can kick up your legs now
I ain't lying, got hitters on top of hitters
Got hitters on top of hitters
Rest in peace to my nigga Lil Bleek
I miss you, I miss you nigga
Just tryna live and have a lil fun nigga
Nephew just came home, half a million dollar bond nigga
I got fans that bust yo ass, you talk bout Boosie baby
Got off my ass, went got that bag and Boosie made it
Hate that, nigga

[Hook: Young Thug]
Niggas say they fuck with you, I can't tell, $500,000 Chevelle
I got bricks and birds for retail, I got 100,000 worth of belts
These bitches and these niggas know that they can't play around here
I call the spot elementary cause I keep a K around here
All my Aces if you play they make you grady baby
I might shoot you in your head and then it's no more thinking
Pussy boy I'll leave you dead and call it dead-ication
I put Act inside my drink, they call it medication

description.plain:
“Can’t Tell” is the third song off of Young Thug’s debut studio album Barter 6. Thugga and T.I. team up again for another banger, also featuring Boosie Badazz.

On this song, Young Thug throws a possible shot at Lil Wayne in the hook with the line, “Pussy boy I’ll leave you dead and call it dedication”. A reference to Lil Wayne’s Dedication mixtape series.

songs.title: Killed Before
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
We got London On Da Track

[Chorus]
Everyone know I've been killed before
I've been bent like a centerfold
I crap with my money, no-oh
Drop the top, get a breeze, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
Got four million in jewelry, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa)
Let that money fly to the ceiling, whoa-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa-oh)
Did you pay someone's tuition? No-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa-oh)
Do you own a store? No-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa)

[Verse 1]
Yeah, fuck all this bullshit (Slatt)
Diamonds for all us kings, yeah (Yah)
Got my money, went Ludacris (Let's go)
Give some racks to a hood bitch (Hoo)
Give some racks to a pulpit (Woo)
Look at the grain, it's wood, bitch
On the floor, it's a wool, bitch
She suck dick like a whole tick (Come on)
Diamonds on me, they cold as shit (Phew)
I thank God that I went legit (And what?)
When we see 'em, you know we blitz (And what?)
I can bet up, you know I'm rich (Let's go)
Shut the fuck up, nigga, bet up, you say you rich
Different color diamonds, I'm a peacock
Different color diamonds, I'm a peacock
Spot full of birdies with no treetop
You know you my son, you can't be dad
I bought the boat, the jet-skis
Got an FN and a stick, don't test me
I stacked them hundreds up to God knees
I ain't goin' broke until 2070

[Chorus]
Everyone know I've been killed before
I've been bent like a centerfold (Whoa)
I crap with my money, no-oh
Drop the top, get a breeze, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
Got four million in jewelry, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa)
Let that money fly to the ceiling, whoa-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa-oh)
Did you pay someone's tuition? No-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa-oh)
Do you own a store? No-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa)

[Verse 2]
We ain't lettin' these bitches get between us
We ain't lettin' no monkey niggas stand that close to us (Close to us)
I ain't got no heart when it come down to my bro, yeah (Yeah)
She is not my dresser, she just iron my clothes, yeah (Thanks)
Pulled off in a Tesla, pulled back in a Porsche, yeah (Skrrt skrrt)
'Bout this mozzarella, you'll get burnt like toast, yeah
I get on that bullshit, you'll get extorted, yeah (Extorted)
Six kids with me, didn't think 'bout abortions, yeah
Ayy, I took a thottie out of Magic
Took her to the pent, then I woo-woo-woo, ayy
The private jet came with a stewardess, like ooh-ooh-ooh
Ready for war like a machine, ayy
Came from pillies to post schemin'
Now I got fifty hoes on they knees
I put an X in my codeine (Oh-oh)
But I'm putting nothing in my weed (Oh-oh)
And I took a jet right overseas (Oh-oh)
I want some head from overseas (Oh-oh)
I caught a case, my jewelry seized (Oh-oh)
I started off with fifty keys (Oh-oh)
My Bentayga clean like bleach (Oh-oh)
On a yacht with blue water and blue cheese
On this shit like fleas, ayy

[Chorus]
Everyone know I've been killed before
I've been bent like a centerfold
I crap with my money, no-oh
Drop the top, get a breeze, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh
Got four million in jewelry, oh-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa)
Let that money fly to the ceiling, whoa-oh-oh-oh-oh (Whoa-oh)
Did you pay someone's tuition? No-oh-oh-oh-oh
Do you own a store? No-oh-oh-oh-oh

[Outro]

The private jet came with a stewardess, like ooh-ooh-ooh

songs.title: Memo
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
We got London On Da Track

[Pre-Chorus]
I'ma pull up on a nigga bitch in my bitch whip (skrrrrrrrt)
I got twenty chains on me, they gon' chip just like some dip (sheesh, sheesh)

[Chorus]
Niggas know, they get the memo (They get the what?)
Stack them racks, they know the memo (Stack it up, stack it up)
Nigga, stop playin', you know the memo
Yeah, look at what she sayin', she know the memo
Yeah, she know the memo

[Refrain]
Check my swag, check my bag filled with cash, nigga
Hundred bands in my pants, check the stash, nigga
Yeah, she bad, run that back, throw some racks, ayy
Break her heart, write your name like a cast, yeah

[Verse 1]
Price of condo, bale, this not no grass, no
Take it out the cat and beat that ass, woah
If you cut my jewels, I'ma pull up and shoot
And I, I do my shoppin' on Fairy, no tooth
You just pull up, I'm not fuckin', I'ma still show what it do
Ride around with Ugly Duckling, we just put two somethin' on a Bu (That's a Bugatti)
Man, I'm so high I think I just seen a UFO with them troops (What?)
Bitches just see us and smile like what it do

[Pre-Chorus]
I'ma pull up on a nigga bitch in my bitch whip (skrrrt, ayy)
I got twenty chains on me, they gon' chip just like some dip'

[Chorus]
Nigga know they get the memo
Stack them racks, they know the memo
Nigga, stop playin', you know the memo
Yeah, look at what she sayin', she know the memo, yeah
Yeah, she know the memo

[Verse 2]
I don't play on Arthur, but I'm moonwalkin'
I know who gon' catch a body, I know who rockin'
When I die, I want a hundred bands inside my casket
I drink Act', I smoke that gas, I smoke that loud, sirens
Yeah, yeah, I take molly with the YSL, memo (Slat)
I supply 'em with them bricks and bales, memo
I'm gettin' money, nigga, can't you tell? (Hell yeah)
Rollie silver like a handcuff, no jail, memo
I'm so fresh they want a pic
Pull up on 'em, suckers kickin' shit and with the shits
I thought you were rich but you so broke I don't know shit
My big brother Bankroll told me I was gonna be the shit

[Chorus]
Nigga know they get the memo
Stack them racks, they know the memo
Nigga stop playin', you know the memo
Yeah look at what she sayin', she know the memo
Yeah she know the memo

[Refrain]
Check my swag, check my bag, filled with cash, nigga
Hundred bands in my pants, check the stash, nigga
Yeah she bad, run that back, throw some racks, aye
Break her heart, write your name, like a cast, yeah

[Outro]
Memo
Memo
We got London On Da Track
Yeah, they know the memo
Memo

description.plain:
Thug talks about how his rap career has affected him and those around him.

The idiom “to get the memo” means to become aware of a situation, especially one that most people already know about.

Thug wants you to know that he’s already making money; if you didn’t already know this, then you need “to get the memo”.

Official Music Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mEzRQYDVD_4

The beat used here is identical to the one used on his track ‘Check’ where he similarly raps about his success and wealth.

Hahaha (SLIIIIIIIME)
Sike!
I’m Pippen, I’m Scottie, Hi Scottie
Take off on body

Master P voice, Master P choice

Good energy, I invest in my queen
I can ride on this hoe like a new 12 speed
My bitch, bad, tragedy
Bitch, bad, tragedy

[Chorus: Young Thug & Shiloh Dynasty]

Said you found a better climax (Tsh-tsh-ah)

description.plain:
“Climax” is the first collaboration between Young Thug and 6LACK. Although it is their first collaboration, 6LACK dedicated an interlude on his sophomore studio album to Thug.

On the song’s chorus, Thug interpolates Shiloh Dynasty’s “Losing Interest,” which can be heard here.

On August 15, 2018, 6LACK posted an image of himself in the studio with Thug, which may be when this song was recorded.

On September 23, 2018, Thug posted a trailer for On the Rvn on Instagram. Within the trailer was a portion of the beginning of this song.

6LACK was formerly a battle rapper in college, and in this video he is seen battling against Thug, proving they have known each other for quite some time.

songs.title: Sin
songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Young Thug]
Man, fuck all y'all (just come wit' me)
Everything I do is for us only (yeah, yeah)
Only us, none of y'all other niggas (I know none of y'all can't tell)
It's on God
(I'm in London, got my beat from London)

[Chorus: Young Thug]
Ayy, ayy, I'm drippin' again
The way that I drip this shit should be a sin
Ayy, ayy, divorce all my friends
I'm not a Migo, 'bout to trap out the Benz
Ayy, they told me don't spend
I went got the racks and I did it again
Ayy, I think she a twin
Plus she got red calamari skin
Ayy, you don't got no wins
You should grab something white and just throw it on in
I went to school, got suspended
I told her I want some head, bobby pin
If the lil' kid don't got class, yeah we calling truancy
I ain't had no money to spend
I got my first check and went paid off my rent

[Verse 1: Jaden Smith & Young Thug]
I poured a four from the clouds down
And my head floating in bliss (goddamn)
I'm on the phone with big bro now (damn)
He told me keep Benz on the race (goddamn)
Until you see it like this, I promise man you'd never think it exists
Straight out a jet to the crib, I'm quick with the switch
Man we never miss, okay (god-)
'Bout to turn up in the club, man, back the fuck up
We ain't takin' no pictures
See all the wings in the front, it's us
We had to triple the digits
See all those sexy mamas blowing kisses, man
We had to grant all they wishes (we grants-)
Casamigos got me spinnin'
But I want some spendin' some out wit' some dealers
Let's go (goddamn)

[Verse 2: Young Thug]
I'm rocking Dior Sauvage (damn)
I'm higher than Scotty, they calling me Pippen (god)
I got some Cartier vision, it costs me six thousand
I'm watchin' these women
Money's the reason I'm sinning
Money's the reason I gotta take Ritalin
You niggas don't care 'bout women
Just shut the fuck up, yeah I'm taking care plenty
I put Chanel on a belt buckle, of when my price is half off
I keep a stick for my cover, got way more girls than Hugh Hefner
Got the same name as the butler
But more money than Ashley and her mother
Got a backwood full of sherbert, I'm 'bout to smoke like a murder

[Chorus: Young Thug]
Ayy, ayy, I'm dripping again
The way that I drip this shit should be a sin
Ayy, ayy, divorce all my friends
I'm not a Migo, 'bout to trap out the Benz
Ayy, they told me don't spend
I went got the racks and I did it again
Ayy, I think she a twin
Plus she got red calamari skin
Ayy, you don't got no wins
You should grab something white and just throw it on in
I went to school, got suspended
I told her I want some head, bobby pin
If the lil' kid don't got class, yeah we calling truancy
I ain't had no money to spend
I got my first check and went paid off my rent

[Verse 3: Jaden Smith]
Ooh, hop out the back of the turn up
Avoid all the cameras, I did it on purpose
She tryna act like she perfect
I see all the masks that you leave on the surface
She made me write all my verses in cursive
She need all them purses at Hermès
That's like 25 racks and we always on a roll
Man, we always working, let's go

[Verse 4: Young Thug]
Ay, let me pour up some Act, got some brand new graffiti
It's going down my back
I got Chanel slippers, Gucci pennies, baby, girl you can pick
Rocking Giuseppe Zanotti's a night
I spent half a million designer on kits
I got Chanel slippers, Gucci pennies, baby girl you can pick
I got so high, went off the equator, I feel like Buzz Lightyear
I met a broad, skinny like nails, and I was richer than ice cream
I had to grind without a rail, now all my cars got Nitron
Straight to Dubai, I feel like the mail, I was on a Global Express

[Outro: Young Thug]
I had to grind without a rail, now all my cars got Nitron
Straight to Dubai, I feel like the mail, I was on a Global Express
I'm in London, got my beat from London

description.plain: “Sin” is Young Thug’s first collaboration with Jaden Smith. When this song was recorded, both artists were supporting acts on J. Cole’s KOD Tour. Additionally, in October 2015, footage of Jaden meeting Thug surfaced online.

songs.lyrics:
[Produced by Ricky Racks]

[Intro: Young Thug]
Slatt!
Aye, get out your motherfuckin seat to this one, you know?

Workin calculators, when we fuck with weight we count them digits
Got bergalo and troupe, they with me (they real neighborhoods)
Bang a neighborhood, 60's, Tiny Locs, they official '
I get, I get it, I get it, however, I get it, I get it on my own

Thousand dollars on cologne
All these extras, I bought me a home
And it's big like a dome
Hold, up country boy callin' my phone (Brr) (man I just saw them)

[Pre-Hook: Young Thug]
Hundred rounds in a Tahoe
Nigga, lighting up your tacos, hey
Give him surgery, no lipo
Down, man, that bitch will pull you down
Pull up to a nigga town
I'm prepared to take 'em down, nigga

[Hook: Young Thug]
Hey, this that slime shit, hey
YSL shit, hey
Killin' 12 shit, hey
Fuck a jail shit, hey
Drinking actavis, hey
On that snail shit, hey
Cookin' white brick, hey, hey
Bricks and Bales shit, hey, hey
Bitch, I'm super rich
Bitch, I'm stupid rich
I-I go ape shit, call that Ludacris, hey, hey
I'm not new to this, hey, I'm so true to this, hey
I done put a whole slime on a hunnid, bitch, hey, hey

[Verse 3: PeeWee Roscoe]
This that slime shit
This that mob shit
This that 100,000 dollars do the job shit
Down to die about this rap shit cause it’s too much money
They say we gettin' money
Now these niggas actin' funny
And they all fake, like some bitch titties
Tell they bitch another lie cause we ain't fuckin' wit 'em
And they groupie niggas and they ho type
Fuck the judge, YSL, this that mob life

[Outro: PeeWee Roscoe]
We got these bankrolls on us
We in Vegas
Now I ain't goin back and forth with ya'll
Hello? Yeah, I'mma bet me a 100,000
All motherfuckin hundreds
Shit, yeah, put me up

description.plain:
“Slime Shit” is another song dedicated to Thug’s slime obsession, aptly titled on Slime Season 3.

Thug explains the meaning of “Slime” here around the 25 min mark:

https://youtu.be/ip8dztJp840?t=25m4s

songs.title: Tomorrow 'Til Infinity
songs.lyrics:
[Intro: Young Thug & Gunna]
(Hope I see you, tomorrow
I'm tryna see you, tomorrow)
Yeah, I'm the black Christian Grey, you know what I'm sayin'?
(I wanna be you, tomorrow)
I got fifty shades of baes with me, fifty different bitches
Yeah!
I want to see you
I want to see you
I'ma see you, tomorrow
Ooh I'ma see you
Can't wait to see you
I'ma see you, tomorrow

[Verse 1: Young Thug]
I know you ride ride ride
I got three bitches on the slide
I put some Forgis on my ride
Me and my dawgs headed to the sky
Cloud nine calling me
Couple bad bitches, too
I got money on me
Listening to "Digits", ooh
Feet up, baby girl, let's live
PJ money, yeah, Bentley's gonna deliver, mm
Two racks for my shoes, my Jimmy Choos
My bitch in Chanel, pity the fool
I got Chanel on my socks, ayy
Silk and Versace her crotch, ayy
Ben and Jerry, 'bouta eat her ice cream
I came from pillar to post
Ice in my bag, my back on froze
Penthouse home, Chicago
Yeah, that my second home
I'm in Atlanta, though
I just got back home
I got my money now
Tat my ribs, Hillstone, yeah

[Pre-Chorus: Young Thug & Gunna]
I just wanna see tomorrow
I'm tryna see tomorrow
Let's fly away, long time, ain't late
I was speed racing

[Chorus: Young Thug & Gunna]
I know you ride, ride, ride
But I'm tired of trying
No matter what, you gotta stay by my side
Right or wrong, you better ride or die
'Til infinity, 'til infinity, 'til infinity, 'til infinity
Ride, ride, ride, 'til infinity

[Verse 2: Young Thug]
I'm about to buy you your own ride
I don't need you involved in homicides
Got this weed from Texas you think you fried
I'm 'bout to fuck this ho outside
Horses make my three-wheeler slide
Actavis gang 'til I (yeah) die
Shawty was weak, oh-oh, gangbangers
Shawty was weak, oh-oh
Hold up, money is the reason I arrived
Bitch, I keep a knife like Michael Myers
I was 'bout to stab 'em thirty times like porcupines
And I got rainbow diamonds on like Mike 'n' Ikes

[Interlude: Young Thug & Gunna]
Oh, yeah
Oh, yeah
Oh, yeah
Oh, yeah

[Chorus: Young Thug & Gunna]
I know you ride, ride, ride
But I'm tired of trying
No matter what, you gotta stay by my side
Right or wrong, you better ride or die
'Til infinity, 'til infinity, 'til infinity, 'til infinity
Ride, ride, ride, 'til infinity

[Outro: Young Thug]
I wanna see you, tomorrow
I'm tryna see you, tomorrow
I'm tryna see you, tomorrow
Tomorrow

description.plain: In the second track off of Young Thug’s album ‘BEAUTIFUL THUGGER GIRLS’, he is referencing a special girl, likely his fiancee Jerrika Karlae. He will do everything in his power to keep her from leaving his side, and wants to be with her ‘tomorrow and til’ infinity'.

description.plain: “Never Made Love” features Young Thug and Rich Homie Quan singing together over a lush, melodic beat. This song is older, most likely from Rich Gang recording sessions, as Thug and Quan have recently had a falling out. Thug even called Quan ‘Bitch Homie Quan’ in concert, though Quan downplayed it saying that he was focusing on his music and didn’t care about beef.

description.plain:
“King TROUP” is about deceased rap artist Keith Troup. Troup was a close friend of Young Thug before he passed in December 2015.

A video was released on Thug’s YouTube channel on 8th April 2016.

description.plain:
Thug said he named the tracks on his album after his idols, people he’s influenced by. This one is named after Future, fellow Atlanta rapper.

Thug & Future recently collaborated on “Who” from Project E.T.. Previous Thug x Future tracks include “Chanel Vintage” & “California Rari”.

They have previously gone back and forth on
Twitter in 2015.

But their beef is over and Future brought out Young Thug to perform at both Summer Sixteen concerts in Atlanta.

Thug posted this on twitter:

I have nun in the world against future I listen to his music His music makes me
happy
and I hope he continues to bless me and others with it
— Young Thug

On July 15th, Young Thug posted a snippet of him dancing to new music on Instagram with the caption “JEFFERY”. On August 26th, the song “Future Swag” was finally released, and it’s one hell of a banger.

description.plain: The title is “Gangster Shit,” and that’s just what Young Thug raps about on this 2016 single. Produced by Wheezy, the song ended an unusually long drought for the hyper-prolific Atlanta rapper. His previous track, “Texas Love,” had dropped more than a month earlier. When the song debuted on Apple Music’s Beats 1 radio show, it was unclear whether the track would appear on Hy!£UN35, Thugger’s long-awaited official full-length debut, or I Came From Nothing 4, the mixtape he was also prepping.

description.plain: Udigg asks the coded question, “Do you dig what I’m saying?”. This is immediately funny, since 95% of the population does not know what Young Thug is talking about or even understand the words that he is saying. Thugger then proceeds to lay out a manifesto of sorts, talking about where he came from (nothing), the things that are important to him (bands), the type of person that he is (a boss), and the sort of things that he might do (who ride a car, steal your girl, bring it on, or maybe show mercy). He declares his loyalty to the Bloods and his personal crew, YSL. Ultimately he just wants the bands, though.

description.plain:
“High” is Young Thug’s official remix of Elton John’s 1972 track “Rocket Man.” This song marks the first collaboration between the two.

A collaboration between the two has been anticipated since March 8, 2016, when rumors began that Thug was working on a remix of John’s “Rocket Man.” The two were later pictured together on March 23, 2016, furthering the collab rumors. Thug’s remix of “Rocket Man” was eventually leaked online more than two years later on August 21, 2018, under the name “Elton Likes Me,” and was subsequently released a month later as “High.”

As Genius reported, producer Stelios Phili stated that this song’s official release was expedited due to the popularity of the leaked version.

description.plain:
“To Me”, previously speculatively titled “Everybody” by some, is a leaked song by Young Thug. Thugger first teased the song on his Instagram after he had dropped the single, “Safe”, and many thought that it would be the first single off of BEAUTIFUL THUGGER GIRLS; however, this wasn’t the case.

The song seems to be an ode to his on and off girlfriend, Jerrika Karlae, who is often a topic of Thug’s music regardless of the status of their relationship.

On February 25, 2018, Thugger’s go-to engineer, Alex Tumay, posted a short clip of him mixing the song on his Instagram story. As such, some believe that it may appear on producer Wheezy’s upcoming album.

description.plain:
“Up” is the second track on Young Thug’s 2018 EP, Hear No Evil. It’s the second song by Thug named “Up,” following 2015’s “Up (Slime Season 2).”

This track features Philly rapper Lil Uzi Vert, who collaborated with Thugger multiple times before. Songs like “Big Racks,” “Yamborghini Dream,” “Bag” and “Yea Hoe” show the chemistry the two rappers have together.

On “Up,” both artists brag about their wealth and the women they get.

description.plain:
Interestingly, this track’s chorus features similar lyrics to the chorus on Kendrick Lamar’s LOVE. off of DAMN.
@zacari provided the hook to “LOVE.”, which was released over two months earlier than “Do U Love Me.”

Also worth noting is the possible sampling by @londonondatrack of Yellow Claw’s Invitation, due to the similarities between the intro of “Do U Love Me” and the beginning of “Invitation.”
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OLbU8zE3pJg

description.plain:
Produced by hit-maker London On Da Track, “Beat It” is your stereotypical Thugger track that’s highlighted by its melodic vibes and questionable bars that have you guessing what he’s actually saying. It’s reported that this was recorded during the studio sessions of Barter 6.

Despite initial leaks suggesting the feature was Jacquees it turns out the feature was really Jeremih.

https://twitter.com/Jacquees/status/580866315222548480

description.plain:
“Swizz Beatz” is the stage name of Kasseem Dean, a producer and rapper who is known for their work with artist like DMX, Cassidy, Jay Z.

Young Thug named every song on JEFFERY after his idols,but the songs rarely have anything to do with the person it pays homage to, which we see here.

description.plain:
“Cruise Ship” is one of two solo Thug songs from his collaborative project Super Slimey with Future, with the other solo Thug song being “Killed Before.” The song is produced by BL$$D and Chef. BL$$D is also known for producing “Relationship,” from Beautiful Thugger Girls, with Billboard Hitmakers.

Cheat Code, Thugger’s longtime friend and collaborator, who describes their relationship as being Thug’s “blood brother,” released a demo of the song, featuring a different recording of Thug’s vocals and a verse from himself shortly after Super Slimey was released.
https://soundcloud.com/cheat-code-ysl/young-thug-ft-cheat-code-cruise-ship-original-version

description.plain:
Young Thug releases his latest song and visual “Texas Love,” dedicated to the victims of the late April 2016 Houston floods.

Saying this via his Instagram:

Hey y'all, took some time out to Direct and edit my latest visual & song “Texas Love” Dedicated to all the love ones affected by the flooding recently in Texas.. My heart goes out to all of whom were lost and still trouble by this tragedy. ❤️ Video out now..

[Refrain]

Who you loyal to? Me or us?

[Verse 1]
Ow!

And you said you were doin' it, you're doin' it, you're doin' it
You say that what you're doin', you're doin', you're doin'
You told me that what, what you're doin', you're doin', you're doin'
What would you do?
If your brother left you, what would you do?
If them niggas came for you, you better pursue (watch out)
I just spent 10 racks on a dog from Germany, no Purdue
Oops, I meant Dupree, jewelry sitting on A/C
Yeah, yeah, yeah

I wanna know

Humming

[Refrain]
Well this is why-a-why-a-why
Well this is why-a-why-a-why
Well this is why-a-why-a-why

description.plain:
Originally teased in 2015, this song is a prime example of Thugger’s ability to rap over a variety of instrumentals. It was rumored to have been intended to be for a potential Post Malone and Young Thug mixtape, but the project never came into fruition.

After Beautiful Thugger Girls’s release, Thug announced via Instagram that a Travis Scott feature would be added to the song. Travis Scott’s verse, along with an extra Thug verse, eventually were added to the project via the vinyl edition of BTG, which was ripped to the internet mid-December 2017.

Producer Charlie Handsome also revealed in mid-2017 that he had wanted Frank Ocean on the track, but Frank’s schedule got in the way and his contributions were, thus, never recorded.

description.plain:
The title track of Young Thug’s September 2018 EP alludes to the uncertainty of Thug’s freedom and how he may be “On the Run” in order to escape serving jail time.

Less than three days before announcing On the Rvn, Thug was charged with eight felonies, including seven drug-related charges and a firearm charge. Then, on the day following the EP’s announcement, a warrant was issued for Thug’s arrest in DeKalb County, Georgia.

Following the EP’s initial release, Thug took to Twitter to announce that Offset was meant to be featured on this song. He followed this tweet with a heartfelt apology to Offset. The song was eventually updated with Offset’s verse on October 6, 2018, which can be heard here. The updated version has the same run-time of 4:24, minimizing a large portion of Thug’s second verse.

description.plain:
“Now” is the third and last track on Young Thug’s 2018 EP, Hear No Evil.

This song features Atlanta rapper 21 Savage. Both rappers previously appeared on multiple tracks together such as “Offended” and “Issa.”

Thugger and 21 talk about their wealth and how far they have come, which is a theme throughout this project.
